forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 1am, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy, with a low around 60. Southeast wind 14 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 40 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms before 7am, then rain between 7am and 10am, then showers and thunderstorms between 10am and 1pm, then rain. Cloudy. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 59 in the afternoon. South wind 16 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 46 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches possible.

weather_report:
As the clock whispers beyond midnight, Downtown San Francisco finds itself draped in a cloak of impending rain, stirring with shadows of clouds racing across the sky. A low murmur of thunder rolls in the distance, punctuating the night with an atmosphere thick with anticipation. The wind, a spirited companion, rakes through at a brisk pace, playfully tousling hair and rustling leaves, while the scent of rain teases the senses—a promise of moisture soon to drench the streets.

Come morning, the city will awaken to a symphony of showers and thunderstorms, interlaced with brief moments of reprieve. The temperature will barely rise, lingering in the cool embrace of the mid-sixties before retreating slightly as the day unfolds into the afternoon. It’s a day best suited for resilient attire; layers will be critical, with a waterproof jacket serving as your steadfast shield against the drizzles and gusts that beckon from the south. A brisk walk along the waterfront while embracing the invigorating scent of wet earth might prove splendid for the soul. Alternatively, settle with a warm cup of coffee in a cozy café, watching the world transform under the cascade of rain—each droplet a reminder of San Francisco's ever-changing temperament.
